Placemark.name: stealth thinkpad
Placemark.Snippet: Complete new bottom half + RAM cover on my T9300 X61 - I like the look - no Windows COA, no MAC stickers, etc =]

Placemark.name: run cool
Placemark.Snippet:
Reflect-A-Gold tape where the wifi card generates heat on a palmrest I got on eBay for my new frankenlaptop project (the rare top bin CPU Lenovo ThinkPad X61 - Intel T9300 2.5ghz)
The laptop itself came so beat up and gross that I'm replacing almost everything except the motherboard/proc and the LCD. New lower half, keyboard and upper half (shown) pending install.
Placemark.description:
Open photo page Reflect-A-Gold tape where the wifi card generates heat on a palmrest I got on eBay for my new frankenlaptop project (the rare top bin CPU Lenovo ThinkPad X61 - Intel T9300 2.5ghz)
The laptop itself came so beat up and gross that I'm replacing almost everything except the motherboard/proc and the LCD. New lower half, keyboard and upper half (shown) pending install.

Placemark.name: ips panel
Placemark.Snippet:
IPS (on left) vs a TN panel - what a difference!
Left is my latest acquisition - the last of the true ThinkPads (X230+ moved to island style keyboards)
Lenovo ThinkPad X220
Intel Core i7-2640M 2.8ghz
16gb Kingston HyperX DDR3 1600
Samsung 830 256gb SSD

Placemark.name: kingspec ssd
Placemark.Snippet: Another KingSpec - this one for my X41. unfortunately the X41's BIOS doesn't like non-Lenovo drives, and gives the nasty double BIOS beep. All the same, compared to the 4200rpm 1.8" spinner that comes with the X40/X41, this is a massive improvement. Looks like the casing has changed a bit and it's a little bit faster than my other KingSpec.
Placemark.description: Open photo page Another KingSpec - this one for my X41. unfortunately the X41's BIOS doesn't like non-Lenovo drives, and gives the nasty double BIOS beep. All the same, compared to the 4200rpm 1.8" spinner that comes with the X40/X41, this is a massive improvement. Looks like the casing has changed a bit and it's a little bit faster than my other KingSpec. Taken on January 15th, 2011 by immaculate aaron 18,  pata,  solidstatedrive,  kingspec64gbssd ... Placemark.name: thinkpads
Placemark.Snippet:
change I don't really care for - ThinkPad X-series laptops getting wider and wider with screen resolution that doesn't really fit for productivity.
X61s on top (1024x768)
X200s middle (1440x900)
X1 Carbon Touch bottom (1600x900)
